intro: Palicourea gomezii, commonly known as the Mexican moonseed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Palicourea gomezii is also valued for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses in treating various ailments.
